titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Thomas Kent, Indictment
CWG8547

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
State of Kentucky October Term 1862
Jefferson Circuit Court October 28th 1862
The Commonwealth Plff
Against Indictment felony
Thomas Kent Deft

The defendant being solemnly called to appear in discharge of the recognizance entered into by him in this Court, on the 31st July 1862, came not, but made default. It is therefore considered by the Court, that the Clerk of this Court issue a writ of Scire facias against said Thomas Kent together with John Keagan and W C D Whipps his bail, to shew cause if any they have or can why the Commonwealth shall not have judgment and Execution thereon against them, the said Kent in Four hundred dollars, and the said Keagan & Whipps in a like sum by reason of the forfeiture of sd recognizance, and for a breach of the condition thereof. And on motion of plaintiff by Attorney, a Capias is awarded her herin returnable &c which Capias shall be endorsed bail in Four hundred dollars with good and sufficient security in a like sum conditioned &c.
A Copy, attest Jas P Chambers C. J. C. C

State of Kentucky
Jefferson Circuit } May 4. 1863.

The defts John Keegan & W O D Whipps being duly summoned & failing to answer &c is considered by the Court that the plff recover of said defendants the sum of four hundred dollars, the debt in the scirefacias reimbursed. Also her costs herein expended, And may have Ecen &c
A Copy Att J P. Chambers

Commonwealth
vs } Copy Order &c
Thomas Kent
W. K. Thomas wishes this fine remitted
